body: Thank you for reporting this. Just to be sure, which version did you reproduce this with?
I am using 4.4.1, and reproduced it with the test above on master also.
Hi @cowtowncoder, did you have a chance to look into this issue?
@elrodro83 Sorry, was out on vacation for last week and half, so not yet. Hoping to catch up on backlog during this week.
Can reproduce with the test included, investigating.

I can see the issue too. Partial segment accepted for CDATA, should not (only relevant for CHARACTERS). Need to figure out proper fix since this is relevant for accessors other that `getText()` as well.
Actually turned out to be easily solved by forcing longer (Integer.MAX_VALUE) limit on one call for finishing CDATA; now passes all old tests, new one.
... although, now does OOME on one of limit tests. Hmmh.
Fixed a problem that may have existed before wrt cdata content limits; now all tests pass, including one for this issue.
Great! Is there any chance a version can be released with this fix?
@elrodro83 I should be able to do that quite soon, just need to see if there might be other simple fixes to get in; so far this was second fix for 5.0.3.
I just released 5.0.3, should be visible via Maven Central soon. 4 fixes included.

issue.title: Content truncated when calling XMLStreamReader#getText() after CDATA event

repository.name: woodstox
repository.description: The gold standard Stax XML API implementation. Now at Github.

body: Just tested with the new version, but still having some problems, Created https://github.com/FasterXML/woodstox/issues/22
